page.title: 01ORPINGTON
page.content: {Orpington} is a suburb to the {South East of London}. Although there have been settlements since {Roman Times} the main developments in the area started in the {1920s and 1930s}. Being close to the countryside, but with {railway services} to central London, it is a popular {residential area for commuters}. Many of the houses in {Petts Wood} are mock-Tudor in style. In {Orpington} itself there are more conventional detached and semi-detached houses. In {St Mary Cray} many of the houses are older than in the rest of the area. {The Ramsden Estate} consists mainly of flats and maisonettes.
